description.narrative:
The objective of the BSU scholarship programme is to allow well-qualified students from Ghana, Tanzania, Uganda and Nepal to carry out part of their studies at existing English-taught Master degree programmes at Danish universities.
The programme is linked to the Building Stronger Universities programme (BSU), and only Bachelor graduates from the BSU partner universities are eligible to apply. These universities are:
Ghana: University of Ghana, Kwame Nkrumah University of Science and Technology (KNUST)
Uganda: Gulu University
Tanzania: Sokoine University of Agriculture, Kilimanjaro Christian Medical College, State University of Zanzibar
Nepal: Kathmandu University.
While the BSU programme supports institutional capacity development of the seven above- men-tioned universities, including establishment or strengthening of Ph.D. schools, the master pro-gramme will help to ensure that qualified master candidates are available for recruitment as future staff of the universities. The partnerships between the seven universities and Danish universities facilitates the selection of the best qualified candidates and increases the likelihood that the universities in the South will benefit from the master training provided in Denmark.
